title: Winson Meadows
text:
Winson Meadows () is a <a href="biological%20Site%20of%20Special%20Scientific%20Interest">biological Site of Special Scientific Interest</a> in <a href="Gloucestershire">Gloucestershire</a>, <a href="SSSI%20notification">notified</a> in 1974. The site is listed in the 'Cotswold District' Local Plan 2001-2011 (on line) as a Key Wildlife Site (KWS).
Location and habitat.
The site is in the <a href="Cotswold">Cotswold</a> <a href="Area%20of%20Outstanding%20Natural%20Beauty">Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty</a> and consists of two adjacent meadows on the floodplain of the <a href="River%20Coln">River Coln</a>. They are unimproved neutral grassland with marsh.
The southern meadow is continuously wet and can be considered a "true" <a href="water%20meadow">water meadow</a>. It shows evidence of previous management as a water meadow as it has a pattern of ditches. The northern meadow is not so wet. Both meadows include grasses such <a href="Meadow%20Foxtail">Meadow Foxtail</a>, <a href="Yorkshire%20Fog">Yorkshire Fog</a>, <a href="Crested%20Dog%27s-tail">Crested Dog's-tail</a> and <a href="Cocksfoot">Cocksfoot</a>. There is some perennial <a href="Rye">Rye</a> grass in partially improved areas.
The marsh vegetation includes <a href="Juncus%20articulatus">Jointed Rush</a> and <a href="Filipendula%20ulmaria">Meadowsweet</a>. Other species recorded are <a href="Iris%20pseudacorus">Yellow Flag Iris</a>, <a href="Ragged%20Robin">Ragged Robin</a>, <a href="Marsh%20Marigold">Marsh Marigold</a> and <a href="Southern%20Marsh%20Orchid">Southern Marsh Orchid</a>.
